byline.contributor: Oleg Matsnev contributed reporting from Moscow.

abstract: Russia promises free land to people willing to settle its vast and sparsely populated Far East regions; Yuri A Bugaev sees giveaway as opportunity for fellow members of Cossacks rebel group to resume their traditional task of protecting country's borders; critics say plan is unrealistic publicity ploy by government.

headline.print_headline: Russia Looks to Populate Its Far East. Wimps Need Not Apply.
headline.main: Russia Looks to Populate Its Far East. Wimps Need Not Apply.

keywords.value: Ministry for the Development of the Far East (Russia)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A determined Cossack’s quest reveals the gap between fantasy and harsh reality in Moscow’s effort to settle a sparsely populated region....
lead_paragraph: A determined Cossack’s quest reveals the gap between fantasy and harsh reality in Moscow’s effort to settle a sparsely populated region.
